title: [PGI Compiler] url_for_version while fetching from mirror
body:
Hello,

I have copied PGI compiler tarball in the mirror : 

```
~/SPACK_HOME/install_home/mirror/pgi/pgilinux-2017-177-x86_64.tar.gz
```
The actual version of compiler is:

```
version('17.7',  '62d86721f92355a6480f4181cdeeb6e0')
```

When I try to install : 

```
$ spack install -v pgi
==> Installing pgi
==> Fetching file://~/SPACK_HOME/install_home/mirror/pgi/pgi-17.7.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /SPACK_HOME/install_home/mirror/pgi/pgi-17.7.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file://~/SPACK_HOME/install_home/mirror/pgi/pgi-17.7.tar.gz failed.


==> Fetching file:///gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar-adm/SPACK_HOME/pgilinux-2017-177-x86_64.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar-adm/SPACK_HOME/pgilinux-2017-177-x86_64.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar-adm/SPACK_HOME/pgilinux-2017-177-x86_64.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for pgi-17.7-ds56srieuvkapc4hh772owdv3kwn73vk
FetchError: FetchError: All fetchers failed for pgi-17.7-ds56srieuvkapc4hh772owdv3kwn73vk
```

So while fetching from mirror Spack use `version` i.e. `17.7`. The `url_for_version ` method returns `tarball` in the current directory with different version scheme : 

```
    def url_for_version(self, version):
        return "file://{0}/pgilinux-20{1}-{2}-x86_64.tar.gz".format(
            os.getcwd(), version.up_to(1), version.joined)
```

I could rename the tarball while copying to the mirror directory but if there is other way to resolve this, it would be great.
